concise_definition: n. 探测, 调查; v. 探查, 探索, 侦查

definitions.explanation_en: A device or instrument used to examine or investigate something internally, especially in medicine or space exploration, often by inserting it into a body or object.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用于内部检查或调查的装置或仪器，常用于医学或太空探索，通过插入身体或物体内部来获取信息。
definitions.example_en: The doctor used a slender probe to examine the wound without causing further damage.
definitions.example_cn: 医生使用一根细长的探针检查伤口，避免造成进一步损伤。

definitions.explanation_en: A thorough and systematic investigation, especially into a complex issue or scandal, aimed at uncovering hidden facts or responsibilities.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对复杂问题或丑闻进行的彻底而系统的调查，旨在揭露隐藏的事实或责任。
definitions.example_en: A congressional probe into the company's financial practices revealed widespread fraud.
definitions.example_cn: 对该公司财务行为的国会调查揭露了广泛的欺诈行为。

definitions.explanation_en: To examine or investigate something closely and thoroughly, often by using a physical or metaphorical tool to explore unknown or hidden areas.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过使用物理或隐喻性工具，对某事物进行密切而彻底的检查或调查，常用于探索未知或隐藏的领域。
definitions.example_en: Scientists are probing the depths of the ocean to discover new species.
definitions.example_cn: 科学家正在探测海洋深处，以发现新物种。

definitions.explanation_en: To ask persistent or intrusive questions, especially in an attempt to uncover private or sensitive information.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指持续或侵入性地提问，尤其试图揭露私人或敏感信息。
definitions.example_en: The reporter probed the politician about his undisclosed donations.
definitions.example_cn: 记者追问这位政客关于其未公开的捐款。

comparison.analysis: “Investigate” (调查) 是一个更广泛、更正式的术语，泛指系统性地收集信息以查明事实，适用于法律、犯罪、学术等各类场景。而 “probe” 更强调深入、细致甚至带有侵入性的探索，常暗示调查对象具有隐蔽性或敏感性，语气更强烈。
“Explore” (探索) 通常指开放性、好奇心驱动的发现过程，如探索未知地域或新思想，不带有强制或怀疑色彩。而 “probe” 常带有目的性、批判性甚至怀疑性，旨在揭露问题或缺陷，语义更严肃、更具针对性。
“Inspect” (检查) 通常指基于标准或规范的正式审查，如建筑检查、安全检查，强调合规性而非深度挖掘。而 “probe” 更深入，常用于发现隐藏问题，超越表面检查，带有挖掘真相的意味。
